release.action: Fixed the implementation name from jDTAUS Banking RI DTAUS to jDTAUS Banking SPI.
Updated implementation to the 1.1 implementation programming interfaces. The implementation now honours the two new interfaces HeaderValidator and TransactionValidator introduced in the 1.1 SPI.
Updated the XML module descriptor to the 1.1 model version. Removed any Messages in favour of the new jdtaus-banking-messages artifact. Added implementations of methods introduced in the 1.2 API.
Added implementations of methods introduced in the 1.3 API.
When an extension record's value is invalid, its type is reported as invalid, although it is valid.

The size of the internal error message collection may get very large so that collecting all errors during scanning becomes a performance bottleneck when scanning files containing a lot of errors. The implementation got updated to stop collecting error message after having collected 250 messages.

Added classes
  • org.jdtaus.banking.dtaus.ri.zka.PhysicalFileExceptionMessageResolver
    • to resolve Messages for PhysicalFileExceptions introduced in the jdtaus-core-utilities artifact as of version 1.3
Added a missing final modifier to class org.jdtaus.banking.dtaus.ri.zka.PhysicalFileExceptionMessageResolver.
Added support for configuration properties introduced in the 1.4 API version.

Upgraded to latest core features.
  • Removed any internal properties resources and moved any messages to the META-INF/jdtaus/module.xml module descriptor.
  • Added support for compatibility checking.
Added support for Textschlüssel validity dates introduced in API version 1.7.
Upgraded to jDTAUS Core version 1.8 to support exchanging references to the java.util.Locale implementation to use.

Prior to this version tape format extension records were written block aligned using a block size of 150 bytes. This version corrects the tape format implementation to correctly support the non block aligned tape format extension records.
Incorrect positions reported when illegal data detected.
Removed hardcoded checks of schedules and Textschlüssel constraints during reading in favour of interfaces HeaderValidator and TransactionValidator.
